extends javax.swing.JTable

        Parameters:

        Parameters:

      • getNextPopulatedRowNumber

        protected int getNextPopulatedRowNumber(int tableRow)
        Get the next non-empty table row number starting at the supplied index. Rows are empty if the cell values match that returned by the getEmptyRow() method. Hidden columns are ignored
        Parameters:
        tableRow - next table row to check for data, model coordinates
        Returns:
        The next row number containing data

      • assignOIDsToNewRows

        protected int assignOIDsToNewRows(int tempOID,
                                  int oidColumn)
        Assign OIDs to newly added table rows. Some tables use OIDs, when building the table updates used to generate the SQL commands to adjust the database, to match up a row that has had one or more column values or its position in the table changed with the same row prior to the change(s). New rows are initialized with a blank OID (the OID is assigned when the table is written to the database). If a subsequent table store operation is performed then rows with blank OIDs can't be matched, so assigning a temporary OID allows matching.
        Parameters:
        tempOID - Starting number for the temporary OID. This should be negative so as not to duplicate an actual OIDs in another table row
        oidColumn - table column containing the OID, model coordinates
        Returns:
        The updated temporary OID value

      • isTableChanged

        protected boolean isTableChanged(java.lang.Object[][] previousData)
        Determine if any changes have been made compared to the most recently committed table data
        Parameters:
        previousData - current database values for the table
        Returns:
        true if any cell in the table has been changed

      • isTableChanged

        ignoreColumns - list containing indices of columns to ignore when checking for changes; null or an empty list if no columns are to be ignored

      • setFixedCharacteristics

        protected void setFixedCharacteristics(javax.swing.JScrollPane scrollPane,
                                       boolean isRowsAlterable,
                                       int intervalSelection,
                                       CcddConstants.TableSelectionMode cellSelection,
                                       boolean columnDragAllowed,
                                       CcddClassesComponent.ModifiableColor background,
                                       boolean selectWithoutFocus,
                                       boolean allowUndo,
                                       java.awt.Font cellFont,
                                       boolean allowSort)
        Set common table parameters and characteristics. These only need to be set when the table is initially created and do not require to be updated if the table is changed while it is visible
        Parameters:
        scrollPane - the scroll pane in which the table resides. Set to null if the table isn't in a scroll pane
        isRowsAlterable - true if the table's rows are allowed to be changed (e.g., inserted, deleted, moved) via keyboard commands from the user
        intervalSelection - ListSelectionModel selection mode used by the row and column selection models
        cellSelection - table cell selection mode that determines the cell or cells selected when a cell has focus: SELECT_BY_ROW to select the entire row occupied the cell with focus; SELECT_BY_COLUMN to select the entire column containing the cell with focus; SELECT_BY_CELL to select only the cell with focus
        columnDragAllowed - true if a column can be positioned by selecting the header via the mouse and dragging the column
        background - table background color (when row not selected)
        selectWithoutFocus - true to ignore if the table has focus when determining the row colors for selected rows
        allowUndo - true to allow changes to the table to be undone and redone
        cellFont - font to use for displaying the cell contents
        allowSort - true to enable the rows to be sorted by selecting a column header; false to disable sorting

      • pasteClipboardData

        private void pasteClipboardData(boolean isInsert,
                                boolean isAddIfNeeded)
        Paste the contents of the clipboard into the table. The expected format is cell values in a row are separated by tab characters and rows are terminated by new line characters
        Parameters:
        isInsert - true to add new rows to contain the pasted data; false to overwrite existing cells in the paste range and only add rows if needed
        isAddIfNeeded - true to add new rows if the pasted data doesn't fit; false to discard excess rows

      • pasteData

        protected boolean pasteData(java.lang.Object[] cellData,
                            int numColumns,
                            boolean isInsert,
                            boolean isAddIfNeeded,
                            boolean startFirstColumn,
                            boolean combineAsSingleEdit,
                            boolean highlightPastedData)
        Paste the contents of the supplied cell data array into the table. Depending on the input flag values, current rows are either overwritten, excess rows are discarded, or new rows are inserted below the currently selected row to contain the pasted data. The currently selected column determines the column alignment for the pasted data. Pasted column data beyond the table boundaries are discarded
        Parameters:
        cellData - array of cell values to be inserted
        numColumns - number of columns represented by the cell data array
        isInsert - true to add new rows to contain the pasted data; false to overwrite existing cells in the paste range and only add rows if needed
        isAddIfNeeded - true to add new rows if the pasted data doesn't fit; false to discard excess rows
        startFirstColumn - true is pasting of the data begins in the first column; false to begin pasting at the currently cell with the focus
        combineAsSingleEdit - true to combine the pasted data as a single edit; false to not alter the undo manager's handling of the edit sequence (this allows handling externally so that other edits may be grouped with the paste operation)
        highlightPastedData - true to highlight the cells containing the pasted data
        Returns:
        true if the user elected to cancel pasting the data following a cell validation error
